name: Dog
hint: Only mammals with unique nose prints.

name: Tortoise
hint: Water animal with a hard shell.

name: Turtle
hint: Water animal with a hard shell.

name: Rabbit
hint: Long Eared, Fast.

name: Parrot
hint: A bird that can mimic humans.

name: Cat
hint: Domestic animal. Lived with people for around 7,000 years.

name: Kitten
hint: Domestic animal. Lived with people for around 7,000 years.

name: Fish
hint: Aquatic animals that lay eggs.

name: Mouse
hint: Small mammal with large tail. Can be easily found at home.

name: Cow
hint: Domestic animal. Provides an item of great usage.

name: Duck
hint: Small, short-necked water animal.

name: Pig
hint: Stout-bodied, short-legged, omnivorous mammals, with thick skin usually sparsely coated with short bristles.

name: Goat
hint: The first animals domesticated by man in 10,000 B.C.

name: Crab
hint: Poisonous sea animal.

name: Honeybee
hint: Can flap their wings 200 times every second. Love flowers.

name: Sheep
hint: Domestic animal which provide wool.

name: Chicken
hint: Lays about 260 eggs per year.

name: Horse
hint: Use facial expressions to communicate with each other. Used as a ride.

name: Crow
hint: Have the largest brain to body ratio of any bird.

name: Peacock
hint: Colorful ground-feeders that eat insects, plants, and small creatures.

name: Sparrow
hint: Very sociable birds, often nesting in colonies.

name: Pigeon
hint: First bird to deliver messages

name: Hawk
hint: Intelligent birds who have visual acuity (the ability to see clearly) is eight times that of ours.

name: Eagle
hint: Birds with eyes at least four times sharper than a human's.

name: Raven
hint: Highly intelligent animals and can use their beaks to rip objects open, helping them find both food and shelter.

name: Flamingo
hint: Birds that can only eat when its head is upside down.

name: Seagull
hint: Birds which are very attentive and caring parents.

name: Ostrich
hint: Birds that do not fly.

name: Penguin
hint: The only bird that can swim, and walks upright but cannot fly.

name: Owl
hint: They dont have eyeballs, they have eye tubes, found at night.

name: Woodpecker
hint: Have sharp and strong beaks for effective drilling into the trunk.

name: Squirrel
hint: Quite adaptive, they live anywhere they can make a home, from tundra to tropical rainforest terrains.

name: Chimpanzee
hint: Have fingerprints similar to humans.

name: Ox
hint: Can pull heavier loads, and pull for a longer period of time than horses depending on weather conditions.

name: Lion
hint: Carnivores, which are at the top of the food chain.

name: Panda
hint: Smaller than a mouse and weighs about four ounces at birth.

name: Kangaroo
hint: Can jump very high. they cant fart.

name: Monkey
hint: Intelligent animals that are good at solving problems. Mostly live in groups.

name: Elephant
hint: Largest, terrestrial herbivorous mammals in the world.

name: Leopard
hint: Powerful mammals, like to live alone, skilled climbers.

name: Hippopotamus
hint: Their closest living relatives are the aquatic mammals: whales, dolphins and tortoises.

name: Giraffe
hint: Has seven bones in its neck (the same as a human, but they are much larger).

name: Fox
hint: The only type of dog capable of retracting their claws like cats do.
